alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 6:25PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Yavapai County through 715 PM MST... At 623 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Walnut Grove to near Yarnell to just southwest of Congress. These storms were moving at 5 to 10 mph to the south-southeast. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, up to half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall will reduce visibility. Locations impacted include... Congress, Walnut Grove, Wagoner, Yarnell, Peeples Valley, Wilhoit and Glen Ilah. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 258 and 293, and between mile markers 297 and 298. State Route 71 between mile markers 100 and 109. Highway 93 between mile markers 182 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rainfall will create hazardous driving conditions, due to reduced visibility and slick roads.

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
